website_summaries.verdict: Traditional tent from a trusted camping brand.
pros: Has a line inside to dry wet clothing
Comes in a choice of colors
cons: Takes a little longer to put up and dismantle

website_summaries.verdict: For its capacity, extra features like interior hooks, and multiseason durability, this shelter can’t be beat at its price point.
pros: Provides shade on 3 sides, reducing the amount of time spent re-angling as the sun moves along
Has an extended front floor to stretch out on, which doubles as a fourth wall to zip up for privacy
Sturdy enough to last several seasons
cons: Takes longer to set up than quick-draw shelters, and the zipper tends to stick

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price. But....
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up. This is a well made sun shade. It is pretty large too. Worked great when the baby was ready for a nap or when he needed to get out of the sun. One thing I recommend though is to bring a small mallet or something to drive the stake way down in the sand. Also stake down the two side ropes. This thing will fly away if not secured all the way
customer_reviews.author: Cam Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Provides excellent shaded space!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is easiest to set up with 2 people, and a bit trickier (though possible) with one person. We love the size! 4-5 adults can easily fit underneath at once while sitting, or 6-8 children. We are glad it has window vents/unzip areas to keep air-flow going. It provides excellent shade too! It also keeps coolers cooler to keep foods and drinks cooler too! We like the fold out section in the front/the mat area. It offers extended room outside the roofed area, to put/rest messy items and feet! :) The tent materials feel sturdy and work all right. It's kinda snug (but not difficult) getting it taken apart and put back into the bag that it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Marie33kl

customer_reviews.title: GROMMETS
customer_reviews.text: While I may have made this purchase almost two years ago - we flew it with us to Florida for vacation to use for the first time ever. The first time we used it and took it back down all the grommets popped out. The grommets hold the poles in place. I was very surprised with this. Coleman products are normally built to last. Very dissatisfied with this product. It went to the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Myra G. Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have children!
customer_reviews.text: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE! I bought it to be able to use for my 8 month old at the beach. Set it up in our yard just to let my two play and it was perfect. It zips up to enclose it like a tent and it allowed my baby to move around without getting into the grass and such. It’s going to make a great little play pin for her when we go on vacation and do our camping trips. The mesh screen allows you to be able to see in and make sure they are okay. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Get this one!
customer_reviews.text: I spent far more time than on person should trying to find just the right beach tent for our trip. Most look great but when you really look at the measurements or read the reviews, you realize how tiny they are. We got this one at a great price AND it was the biggest one I saw that wasn't super cheaply made. It was really big and worked great. We were able to fit a pack and play and a chair for an adult into it. It does take a little more effort to put together than some of the smaller ones, but it was totally worth it. It also packs up really nicely for carrying. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put together
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a camper. I don’t have experience putting tents together. I read the reviews saying that this sunshade is easy to put together but I have to assume those reviewers have more experience than I do. I tried to set up this sunshade in my home, as practice. I wish I had timed it because it seemed to take forever but was probably more like 30 minutes. The instructions are not helpful. The poles kept getting stuck. My toddler wanted to help. It was pure chaos. I’m not taking this thing to the beach. I’m going to sell it and use the money to buy a more simple sunshade that I can set up quickly on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good For The Price
customer_reviews.text: We used this recently on a beach trip and overall had a positive experience with this tent. We needed something that provided UV protection and this satisfied that. It is large enough for two adults and a small child. It is much easier to set up with two people but it is doable if you are solo. The fabric where you slide the poles thru are pretty cheap. We ripped a hole on the 2nd day of our trip. Do not expect this to last more than a season but for the price I did not expect this to last longer. Would by it again because it is reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: The only con is trying to fold this back up. My 15yo (pictured) is special needs and spent most of the time in it at the beach. He was able to read, snack, and build sandcastles. It did take about 10 minutes to put up because it was a super windy day (red flag). We used the stakes, sand bags, and placed our towel/snack bag on one side that was taking the brunt of it.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: It just works.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent like shelter. You have to thread the guide poles, and you make a sturdy frame that is very strong. Providing you have good anchors, it is very, very durable in the wind. The privacy option is nice (floor comes up & makes a mini tent), this is great for changing clothes at the beach. Very happy with this shelter. Now it’s more complex than the pop ups, but they are inferior when it comes to stability. So for me, stability in the beach wind is a bigger requirement than pop up convenience. Love it. In the picture you can see it’s tall enough for full size folding chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Perry P

customer_reviews.title: Really like this, low profile is unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for sunshade for outdoor church services made necessary by Covid-19. Many people were using umbrellas with their folding chairs. This sunshade is no more obtrusive to the people around you than someone sitting in a chair with an umbrella, maybe less. It is low profile but surprisingly roomy. I bought low profile "sand" chairs for the kids to sit in while they were in the tent. This tent fits our needs well. I think it is good quality and will continue to serve our family, even after this immediate need is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: 2+ years strong, and still going.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first major beachgoing purchase. I'm pleased to say I've had it for over TWO years now and have used it many times. Beach, concerts, winefests, etc. I can set it up by myself and teardown in less than 20 minutes; it's that simple. Faster if I have help. It's sturdy and does the trick. It's good for two adults and a cooler and bags. 3 adults might get crowded but is possible. I do not use chairs under this, I just sit right on the "patio." I've gotten my money's worth over these last two years and expect to get another several years out of it. Pics to he uploaded.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Did its job, just be patient with the rods
customer_reviews.text: Used it on the beach. We were very careful with it so we didn't rip it. It worked perfectly. We did a test run in my living room to practice, I recommend doing that so you aren't standing in the hot sun on a beach trying to figure it out. Just be careful and patient so you don't rip the thin fabric or break the rods. Also, I took the advice of other reviewers and faced it slightly away from the beachfront so the wind didn't blow us away. This worked perfectly. Kept us shaded and as cool as it can be on a July afternoon at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This product was bigger than I thought it would be, but I love it!! It is easy to put up, but taking it down is a different story. There’s no way I’m ever going to get it folded up to fit in that tiny bag every again 😅
customer_reviews.author: Hope Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at so many options on Amazon and other websites. I’m very happy we went with this choice. The wind almost blew it away (because we used 1 gallon water bottles in the four corners). However, as we drank the water the less useful they became as weights. It blocked the sun very well. It can get hot inside if the back window isn’t unzipped. I’d definitely buy another one! Although this tent isn’t a pop-up tent it wasn’t difficult to Put together. I even put it together by myself a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Conlet

customer_reviews.title: Below average quality but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: pros: provides ample space and cooling with a great breezeway. It is very compact and fits easily in most checked in luggage. Cons: Annoying to setup with the use of collapsible poles and cheap grommets. Our first extended (4 consecutive days) use resulted in broken guide hole metal buttons, ripped pole inserts. Setup time takes 5-10 mins and tear down is about the same. It is clumsy and the enclosed travel bag is poorly made. Good luck trying to fold the tent back to it’s original shape to fit in its carry on case. Overall it’s made with slightly below average quality and should be considered a one/two time use item.
customer_reviews.author: Razwan

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!! POORLY DESIGNED AND HARD TO USE!!
customer_reviews.text: I have another beach tent, but bought this one for visiting family to use. Big Mistake! This tent is poorly designed, and might work on a clear windless day if you set it up in the garage. Yes...it is that bad. The supports have to be threaded through narrow channels on the tent...tedious and time consuming. The sand bags don't hold sand..really. You fill the sand bags and then close them with a toggle that just slips the bag open once you put it down. I see that this is now out of stock, but I would say that Amazon should not re-stock it. I am returning mine!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Awesome beach tent!
customer_reviews.text: Went beyond my expectations! I was nervous purchasing this tent because I had never put a tent together before but it was surprisingly simple. It helps to have another person help you and practice before you take it to the beach but only took us about 10 mins to set up on the beach. It was worth it! The shelter is pretty big and was able to withstand some wind all day at the beach. I used the sand bags it came with to fill with sand and use them to anchor the shelter down for the day, I didn’t have to use any of the stakes. Overall, very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Beach Ready!
customer_reviews.text: Did a test run in the backyard the other day. Thought the tent will be a lot smaller since it's in a very small zip carrier. Boy, was I mistaken, the tent was a good size for just about three people laying down.It came with stakes & several bags for sand to hold the tent down. Four net pockets in the interior, 1 @ each corner for phones, lotion, etc. A nice little clothes line in the interior too if you want to hang a towel or two up.
customer_reviews.author: nam nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Good shade shelter
customer_reviews.text: Good shade shelter, bought this for portable shade in the back country and it works well. Replaced the sand spikes with regular tent spikes and added a nylon tarp for a footprint. The only downside is i wish it had clips for the poles instead of the mesh sleeves but it is still relatively easy to set up and take down. The big positives are the doors, really like the back for the large window to let the breeze through. Also like that the front zippers up completely to keep the bug and other critters out when left overnight with my gear inside.
customer_reviews.author: j.d.

customer_reviews.title: grommets broke, no side windows
customer_reviews.text: Update: I bought some inexpensive grommets at craft store and replaced the ones that broke off. The tent has held up and I’m still using it often. Original: On the first use some of grommets that the steaks and poles hook into broke off. Even more grommets broke after the second use. Now I have to find some replacement grommets and see if I can fix it. One other thing...my previous sun tent had side windows and the breeze flowed through better. I did give this a few stars because it protected my family from the sun. I just wish it was built with higher quality materials that would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tent
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews for many other sun tents and decided on this one with hopes it wouldn’t rip and will last and would be easy to set up. We’ve used it once on the beach so far. It is a great size and looks to be well made. Setup was a bit cumbersome and there were 3 of us working on it. I think it would be difficult to do on my own, especially in a windy situation. Also trying to fold it back down to put back in the tiny bag, especially on a non hard surface like sand, is difficult I wish the bag was slightly longer and wider.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Too hot inside, even with the flaps open!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, but when we set it up and sat in it on our beach chairs we immediately started to get hot, honestly, I don't think we will ever use it and I will most likely give it away. Set up isn't too hard, though some of the poles fit quite tightly, so you need some strength to get them in place. We put a small tear in the fabric the first time we set it up, I was not happy about that. My one purchase from amazon that I regret.
customer_reviews.author: agriffin

customer_reviews.title: Good tent, flimsy stakes
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of experience with tents so I got this one after reading the reviews. It was easy to set up. It was used on the beach for two 12 yr olds to hang out to get out of the sun periodically. It was great for that. However, the manufacturer really skimped on the stakes to hold it down. They're very flimsy and light weight. Any wind that came along and a corner was coming up. I also found it difficult to get everything back into the carrying case and ended up breaking the zipper. I recommend the tent and would recommend purchasing more heavy duty stakes for holding it in place.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSmiley

customer_reviews.title: Best Beach Shade
customer_reviews.text: After several trips to the beach, I can say that this is the best there is for the money and durability. It is a little daunting at first when I initially went to put it together. But it came together quickly with one person. Breaking it back down can be a little hard to tackle if a windy day on the beach, which most days usually are. However, we found it best for a two person task. As far as the durability, it provided great protection for our infant, as well as the family dog. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great beach shade!
customer_reviews.author: Stevieclean

customer_reviews.title: Great for the dog!
customer_reviews.text: I take my dog to various events. We went to a dock jumping competition during a particularly hot weekend. This shade tent was really easy to set up (I practiced at home first to figure it out). I put her in her crate in the shade with a fan and then had an aluminet shade cloth over the tent. She actually got cold in there and was shivering. I had to take her out into the sun to warm her up. The take down was also super easy. I could do it myself. I absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tent does the job. It's well put together and sturdy once it's up. All the elements of the tent (tent itself, zippers, screen, tent poles) are well made with the exception of the stakes. Sun protection is pretty good-- the only gripe I have about this is when the back part is rolled up to allow some air flow through the screen, sun comes through on my shoulders when I'm sitting in my chair. I wish there was more airflow on the sides of the tent. It's very difficult to put up by yourself, especially with any type of breeze. With two people, it goes up quickly and provides great sun protection. For the price, it's a good tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never leave without it
customer_reviews.text: We love using this thing. We take it with us every time we go to the beach. The poles are sturdy and can take some abuse. Pros: Provides great shade "easy" to set up (after you get the hang of it) Back can be opened for ventilation Can seat two adults on chairs or a baby stroller All pieces fold into a very small zip-up bag Cons: Can be tricky to set up the first time Works best when its back is to the wind The anchors are a little small and somewhat ineffective It would be a good idea to set it up at home the first time. Much easier to concentrate there without all the distractions.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for the price. (It was 35$ when I ordered). It is made of a good material and has enough space for two and convenient design. The construction may look a bit flimsy but it works. Need to be assembled but that takes couple of minutes after you figure out how to do it. Very compact. Can be kept in a car without taking much space. Comes in a small bag with handles. May be even two small. Ones I unpacked the tent I was unable to squeeze it back in. :) It was more difficult for me than assembling and disassembling. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice beach shade
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic little beach shade! It was the perfect size for two adults and two small children. We are a picnic lunch in the shade, the two adults sprawled out while the kids played in the water, and then the kids changed into clothes before heading home. It is easy to set up (5 minutes) and take down (5 minutes) and very portable. It comes with bags you can fill with sand so you can “stake” It at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany P

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Tent
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT!!! We bought this for the beach since I tend to burn easily and this tent did not disappoint! Great size for two adults with a beach bag and cooler. Yes, the first time you put it up and take it down might be a tad challenging but after you have the process down, it’s a breeze. Comes in a traveling case that fits in a checked bag so we can fly it to and from the beach. So glad I made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Huge pain to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.text: Ugh, where to begin. I wanted something to replace my Sportbrella. I thought this would be nice because it covered the ground and looked easy to put up. It was a huge pain. The area where the poles slide through to set up is made of mesh and the poles kept getting caught. This happened during set up and take down. It was also warm inside the shelter. I couldn't get enough venting and unzipping the back let the sun in. I'm going back to my sport umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Good Ventilation. Easy to Setup
customer_reviews.text: We use this every time we go to the beach. It provides a nice break from the sun. Only you know if you need it, but here is what I think about it after using it for 5 years at least a week per year. I am way more comfortable at the beach with some shade. This tent is ventilated well, sets up easy, has been very durable, and holds up to all levels of typical beach wind. I will buy one again if it ever wears out. I love to nap in the shade on the beach in this tent. I’m cooler and don’t have to worry as much about sun burn.
customer_reviews.author: Skabo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beach
customer_reviews.text: We loved this shelter at the beach. It was spacious and very easy to set up and pull down. I did a trial run in the living room, paying attention to how it was wrapped up, so I’m sure that helped a bit, but I still think it was really easy all around. The screen at the back makes the wind a non-issue and the pockets all around are great for storage. No sunburns this year, so I think this was an A+ purchase.
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Pole broken after 1st use
customer_reviews.text: The tent was great for use at the beach. It kept my infant daughter out of the sun and gave her a place to nap. However, upon disassembly, the cord connecting the pole snapped. I read other reviews mentioning this but hoped it would happen to mine. Well, it did! It still works but makes it 10x harder to assemble.....especially in the beach wind. Wish Coleman designed that differently.
customer_reviews.author: Seth P.

customer_reviews.title: Once it's up, it works great
customer_reviews.text: Fairly durable and roomy inside. I like the fact that you can open the back partially, like a window. Lets the breeze through. It is labor intensive to get it assembled and definitely requires at least two if not 3 people to hold parts while others thread the tubes through to give it its shape. But, once it's assembled, it's roomy and can fit two beach chairs, coolers and bags. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: CCD1963

customer_reviews.title: The Literal Worst
customer_reviews.text: The was absolute garbage. After my husband and I struggled with it for nearly an hour, I bundled it up and marched it over to the nearest trashcan and threw it away. This is not easy to set up by any stretch of the imagination. I'm a seasoned hiker and camper and have put up my fair share of tents and shelters and let me tell you, this was something else. We ended up going to a local grocery store and buying a $6 umbrella that worked like a charm. Don't waste your money but if you do decide you are a lunatic and want to get this, may the odds be ever in your favor.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret T Then

customer_reviews.title: Careful! Poles broke after a few months
customer_reviews.text: We use this tent about 2-3 times a week and we've had this tent for about 2-3 months. The poles have started to crack and we got a splinter from them while setting up the tent. We taped the split poles together and so far it's held up. While inserting the poles into the tent, it caused some holes and tears. Overall, the tent has been useful. But I think we are going to buy a self pop up tent to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: LuluLime

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: Takes about 3 minutes to set up, if you’re at all familiar with Coleman tents. Easiest with 2 people but can do it solo in a pinch. Great if you’re planning to stay at the beach all day. Whether you drink too much and need to sleep it off or get tuckered out playing in the waves, this tent provides a great refuge. Back window zippers open for increased airflow or can be fully opened as a rear entrance. Got compliments all day on what a great tent it was for the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin R Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worth getting if you love being around the beach but need shade at times.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this shade tent was perfect till I had to put it away. If you dont roll it up perfectly it becomes annoying to fit it into the case. It should have been designed as a stuff sack and just jam it down into it. But no it's a wide open rectangle and you still need to get the sticks inside. Gear like this should have been thought out better. But that's it. Other then putting it away the shade tent worked great, easy to put up, and if needed you can get 100% privacy.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sun protection, light weight, easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Lovely light weight tent that is excellent for the beach! This tent is very good at sun protection but it takes two people to set up. It’s more difficult because the poles have to slide into the fabric of the tent and it can get stuck. I used it for several days on the beach and loved it, it held up in some high winds and my whole family was trying to cram in it when it’s really best for 2 or 3 people. Definitely with the money and it fit in my medium size suitcase perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Kismet08

customer_reviews.title: The perfect beach shade!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this tent. After reading comments, I felt like this thing was too good to be true but everything was accurate. It's super compact, light and easy to carry. We set this up every day, for 8 days with zero issues. The first time it was set up it took maybe 10 mins because we wanted to make sure we were putting it up correctly. Every day after that took less than 10 min. We had a really expensive sports shade previously that didn't hold up and this far exceeded that one. If you have kids or just want shade on the beach, this is perfect for you!
customer_reviews.author: NannyBurg

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Travel friendly. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had to put up a tent before, so i i have zero experience with this category. If I found setting this up pretty simple, anyone should. This was a great product that served its purpose very well. This could comfortably fit 2 adults and a baby and the travel-ease selling points were more than I could hope for. I’ve used this twice so far, and I love how little space it takes up when not in use. There were some great little details, like the drying line and pockets that we used as cup holders. It has my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Yam

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: This sun shade is AMAZING! It was so easy to set up (definitely try setting it up before you need it to get familiar with how it sets up) I set it up at home, then when at the beach setting it up, I was a pro! It doesn't quite fold up as easily as some make it sound, but everything will fit back into the bag if wrapped tight It was great shade for my wife at the beach to nurse our baby with enough privacy to feel comfortable to do it in public. Will be our go to sun shade for the beach from now on
customer_reviews.author: Babi

customer_reviews.title: Easy up and down, solid in wind
customer_reviews.text: We used our new beach shade today for first time. Pretty easy set-up, definitely more sturdy than any of the other shade/tents we saw on the beach. Fun interior features like the clothes line and mesh pockets. Roomy enough inside for several bags, and one or two chairs. Take down is easy, but as others have said the carrying bag is small and in my opinion it may be just as well storing everything in a bigger bag (i.e. a spare backpack or reusable shopping bag) instead of trying to wrestle it back into its carrying bag. All in all, very happy with our new beach investment!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Spacious
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! So glad I got this! So much better than an umbrella! My 6’ 2 husband, the baby and I all fit in it easily. This has extended our beach time with the baby by giving great shade, privacy, and a breeze. The only critique is that it does not hold up well with a strong beach breeze—like before or after stormy weather. With more stakes it may hold up —I’ll have to try that next time to know. Wish I found this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice tent once it’s set up. It is not ideal for the beach however, it assembles like a regular tent with poles and stakes and so if you’re putting it up with mild windy conditions- like a beach- it’s very time-consuming and difficult to tear down and put in to the little storage bag. I had to carry it back to my car out of storage bag and re do at home I’ve gotten used to the umbrella sportsbrella style beach tent that takes seconds to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: belzan

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a baby and knew we would need some sun and wind protection for when we took the little guy to the beach and park. We went to the park and used this and it was AWESOME. Really easy to put up and down and has great sun and wind coverage. My husband and I and our baby hung out inside it very comfortably. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Perfect size and excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this thing. It's so easy to assemble and the color is perfect, not too bright or faded. We love to use it at the beach. It was great to seat by the beach and be able to take a nap. It was simply amazing. This tent has storage inside for your phone, keys, credit card, and other small things. The quality is excellent and the privacy is fantastic, all you need to do is zip the opening and open the small window for ventilation. Again I love it and I know you will too. I don't know how I survived withput before.
customer_reviews.author: IG

customer_reviews.title: Best beach purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Took a YouTube video to figure out how to put it up but it was actually very simple! Felt kinda stupid once we figured it out cause it’s very easy. I would recommend practicing putting it up at your house before you go out. Anyway it’s very roomy and provides great shade. I like that it can zip up all the way for privacy and the window in the back keeps it cool in the tent. It’s hard to fold back into the carrier though. Overall 5 stars because it made a 90 degree day at the beach better and was great for my daughter to keep cool.
customer_reviews.author: shawna t.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a popup beach shade, buy this
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to provide shade for our newborn while at the beach. Held up quite sturdily with 10mph winds. We had previously purchased a pop up tent which was total garbage. This tent however was awesome. It took about 15min to setup by myself while my wife corraled the kids. Fill sandbags, lay tent out with correct orientation, attache sandbags, assemble poles and slide in, profit.
customer_reviews.author: Parzival

customer_reviews.title: nice sun shade
customer_reviews.text: It was a struggle to set up the first time especially on the beach. I was going to do a trial run as some other reviewers had but ran out of time before vacation. However once up it provided a nice shade that you didn't have to worry about like an umbrella. air flowed through it nicely and it was much easier to set up and take down after the initial run. It was hard to get back into the carrying case which I didn't bother with until the day we were leaving.
customer_reviews.author: r.d.

customer_reviews.title: A substantial sunshade
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very happy with this product. Yes, it takes a few minutes to put up and the support poles snag on the mesh lining while it's going up. But once it's up and staked down, it's not going anywhere. We've found that there's ample room for two adults and our nine-month-old baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Page

customer_reviews.title: Florida Vacation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my boyfriend’s grandpa when we took him with us in Florida. I figured he wouldn’t like to be under the sun for too long. This is perfect for the beach especially if you guys plan on staying long in the beach for hours. The weather in Florida is not always sunny so we had some rain but this tent saved all of our stuff from being soaked or wet. This is also good for privacy, keeping your stuff secured or together and also for towels you don’t want to get dirty with sand! Very easy to fold and unfold. Takes just about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Dannah

customer_reviews.title: Few minute set-up & take down
customer_reviews.text: After reading some other reviews, it was what I expected. It's a nice, good quality tent that will close completely if needed. It works best for setting it up for a whole day or couple days vs. a short time since it does take a few minutes to set up. I could set it up by myself in 5-10 minutes. Only complaint was trying to get it folded back up into the travel bag was like wrestling a sleeping bag but it did the job and we like it.
customer_reviews.author: ldl

customer_reviews.title: Good size but not technically a pop up tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a good size, and also reasonable quality. However, it is not technically a pop up tent in that you do have to insert poles and set it up like a regular tent. If you want something that springs open or that you can just pull open (like Coleman instant tents), this might not be the right option for you.
customer_reviews.author: Katie B

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an upcoming beach trip with my toddler. I wanted something that could offer sun protection for at least 2 adults and a child. I was worried this would be too small for everyone to fit comfortably but it is larger than expected. It took me about 10 minutes to assemble at home and I can see how it could be difficult to assemble on the beach with wind but 2 people should be able to do it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Brittni

customer_reviews.title: Strenuous set-up, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: It takes awhile to set up, but the tent is fab. We've used it time and time again. It's a must for spending hours at the beach. The interior is small, but it suits our needs. Great quick escape from the sun. We never worry about it flying down the beach or waving harshly in the wind. Once it's in that's where it stays. We feel free to walk down the beach, run into the hotel room quickly, etc.
customer_reviews.author: iea204

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to set up
customer_reviews.text: This beach shade was so hard to put up. It does take some serious time to set up, and if the wind is blowing, give yourself about an hour of setup time. I had to hold my 9 month old and hold the tent down so it wouldn’t fly away as my husband struggled to get it together. I wouldn’t have gotten it if I knew it was going to be so tricky. Takes a while to bring it down and pack up as well. Great shade once up, but not worth a quick trip to the beach for a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after second use
customer_reviews.text: This is ok to set up alone - definitely light enough to carry to the beach. Decent sized height to fit a normal chair and it allows a good breeze through the screened portion. However it ripped on the second use where the main long pole goes - it was not windy - I was just putting it up in my yard setting for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Samatha Smith

customer_reviews.title: Going to the beach?? You need this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ummm WOW! How on earth is this thing so inexpensive?! Just received today I haven’t used yet but I did set it up in my room just to check it out. I mean first impression the quality seems great especially for the price. Hands down five stars wish I could give more. Can’t wait to use it! Destin FL this summer, can’t wait! P.S. this thing will also double as a tent for at least one person maybe even two without a doubt I mean I’m 6’2” and I fit in there relatively easy
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little beach tent for two!
customer_reviews.text: One of my buddies and I use this to hit the beach we hike down to in the summer. Its perfect for two to just kick back and get some shade for a bit and have lunch after sunbathing. I've not yet camped in it or anything but it seems ample if you're not looking for an extended stay. Easy to set up, sturdy, and comes with a nice little bag to carry it in.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk D.

customer_reviews.title: Great little beach tend
customer_reviews.text: Great little tend for the family as most beaches today do not allow closed tents this works out really well. You can use it to lay under to get away from the sun and it is fairly easy to set up. It is great for withstanding a little wind so you don't have to worry about it falling over due to that. The color is a little lighter then what is shown but that is not too much of a problem. Overall I am very happy with this beach tent and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: FieryXeph

customer_reviews.title: Great Beach Tent and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great beach tent. I used it one time at the beach so far and I have no regrets on my purchase. PROS: Sturdy Has a window/zipper in back of the tent. Super Light weight and very portable- comes with a carrying bag Reinforcements you can push into the sand so your tent does not fly away CONS: Takes a bit of time to set up, needs two people to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Ladylindaa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight sun shade
customer_reviews.text: This product is my new favorite thing to bring to any outdoor event. I have a 7 month old and a three year old and shade is required but we love being out in the sun. This beach shade is perfect for someone with little kids or if there is no shade anywhere and you need to rest from the sun. Highly recommend for anyone doing a lot of outdoor activity. :) the poles can get a bit stuck on each other when pushing through, but I was still able to put together while wearing a baby.
customer_reviews.author: E Burke

customer_reviews.title: Great for sun protection, far too small for the bags suppose to fit back into
customer_reviews.text: I thought we outgrew the world of bags that things can't fit back into, but I am sorely mistaken. This tent is great, but not matter what I do I cannot fit it back into the provided carrying bag with it's pieces. If I want just the tent to fit I can make that happen, but tent and poles is a no go.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Miranda

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This pop-up was a JOKE!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!! I bought this to take to the beach with our little one and attempted to practice by putting it up in the front yard. After 30 minutes I was still struggling and had enough. I sent it back and bought something else that literally pops up in a few seconds and works much better. This would have been a NIGHTMARE at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than umbrella rental for sure
customer_reviews.text: We loved having this on the beach this summer. It provided excellent shade and shelter from the wind once it was up. Some areas for improvement: I'm glad I'm experienced with pitching tents- this was not that easy to figure out. I would recommend a trial run to learn how to get it upright without wind and sand. The poles are tethered and that's great, but their a little chunky and stick a little. I feel like I'm being nit-picky because my family really valued the features this offered while on the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Antknee

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, broke after only a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Broke on fourth use, fifteen months after purchase so outside of warranty. One of the pole segments just split down the middle. Even when it wasn't broken it was not particularly to my liking. Having poles that slide through a long sleeve instead of slipping through a series of clips makes it far more difficult to setup than it should be. I have set up many, many tents in my life and this one is the most frustrating by far. Once it is setup, it is quite nice and convenient but now that I have to replace it I will definitely be looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Paul SanGiorgio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to est up with 2 people and a windy beach. Once we put the sand bag inside, it stayed put. as long as the back window was open. even closed the tent was sturdy with things inside to help hold it down. Its totally great for a day at the park or beach to allow, some shade and rest out of the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one similar to this one from Dicks Sporting Goods. It was nice but it didnt have the bottom tarp. The bottom tarp is a must for me. This one was a little more in price but completely worth it. I take it to the lake/beach all the time, its part of my camping equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: If in doubt buy it...great travel shade
customer_reviews.text: For a beach traveler like me I highly recommend this product. It is small enough to put in your checked luggage and not heavy at all. I'm from California with a family of 4 and we took this in our 30" checked bag to Puerto Rico no problems. People were very curious where I got this and we got many compliments. We also took this on our short trip to USVI where we got many more compliments because the people were nice there. Easy to set up and small enough to travel with. LOVE this little tent I bought it again when it went on sale.
customer_reviews.author: queen crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on our recent vacation to Hilton Head. Held up great in some decent wind gusts and is bigger than I expected. Great escape from the summer sun. I highly recommend having 2 people to put it up as it is a difficult alone. You and a friend may or may not argue while you put it together. However other than that it is absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much work to put up
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like the sunshade but the putting it together is real pain. The poles get caught putting them in and taking them out causing the poles to come apart while trying to put the shade up and also when taking it down. Once its up its nice but the work involved is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: cristanella

customer_reviews.title: Not just for beaches!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a motorcycle track day where there would be no shade to hide in. It worked perfectly because it fit easily in my travel bag on my bike, set up quickly in 5 min, and shaded me while still allowing the breeze though.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Mottram

customer_reviews.title: Good beach tent!
customer_reviews.text: If you put the long grey shaft in first where the Coleman decal is and then slide the others up it is a lot easier. After that fasten the black rods to their holes and finish with the grey one. Be sure to the the window open so it won’t blow away. Really good sun shade for the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Cell Geek

customer_reviews.title: My favorite day tent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! The bag for it is very compact and light for easy transport. Once I learned how to set it up I can do it myself in 5 minutes. It is very fun to be in and I like how you can either make it fully enclosed or use the wall as an extended tarp for the front of the tent. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Cool Beach Tent
customer_reviews.text: Perfect beach tent. Small packaging ideal for traveling. We practiced setting it up at home before going to the beach, as was suggested by an existing review and I’m glad we did. It can be challenging to setup on a windy beach alone. Best to setup with two people. My whole family (of four) can fit inside. My 5 and 3 year old took naps inside and were perfectly shaded. The clothes line is also a pretty cool feature.
customer_reviews.author: B.P.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Chic Cozy Beach Shade! 5 Stars !!
customer_reviews.text: This Pink Coleman Beach Shade is so cute and cozy. It comes in a gorgeous chic design style .. *** 5 Stars !! ** They’re easy to set up in a few minutes and durable quality. I bring mine for sun protection when I head to the beach & park. Say Goodbye to the hassles of flimsy, fly away Beach Umbrellas! Thank you Coleman!! :)
customer_reviews.author: KimMarie

customer_reviews.title: Great, compact sunshade--bought 2 and took them to Hawaii.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well during our 9 day stay in Oahu. One problem--one of the metal grommets fell off on day 5 or 6. We purchased 2 shades and traveled with them from Houston. They are compact enough to fit in a suitcase and not too heavy. I would purchase these again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald M. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great sun shade!
customer_reviews.text: We brought this to the beach and am so glad we did! This was a great purchase! First time setting up took a little longer but each time thereafter was quick. Love the pockets to hold our items along with the vented window in back to allow for a breeze. Our little one was able to sit inside to get shade from the hot sun. So glad we bought this!
customer_reviews.author: London Gal

customer_reviews.title: Not Easy to Assmeble
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the shade seems to be good but after 30 minutes of trying to assmble it we just gave up... Needless to say we never got a chance to see how well it protects us from the sun. Will try to find a video to help for our next trip to the beach as the instructions were not very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Awilliams

customer_reviews.title: which is great! We only set it up inside the house ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally opened this thing up yesterday and it's bigger than what we expected, which is great! We only set it up inside the house to see how it is. Seems like it has great coverage from the sun. It has has bag window you can unzip. You can also zip both sides for privacy, in case you need to change clothes. There are also spots on the tent where you can hook up your wet cloths if needed to dry. Like mentioned in some of the reviews, it can get pretty hot inside when zipped up. Other than that, it's seems to be a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Izzasan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to put it up myself when I first got it to check for tears and make sure all parts are there. Been bringing this to the beach every weekend. Light weight, great for sun protection and very easy to set up and break down. Folding it back to fit the bag just needs a little patience :)
customer_reviews.author: K_Bee

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for us on the beach. I'm sure if you were there you would have been laughing hysterically at us. We were frustrated putting it up, it blew away, the stakes wouldn't hold, and it was an all-around disaster. By the time we got it up there was so much sand in it, it just sucked. Go buy a pop-up would be my advice.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bruce

customer_reviews.title: “5 Minute Set Up” is only for those who happen to camp a bunch :(
customer_reviews.text: Brought this thinking that the mentioned “5 minute easy set up” wouldn’t be so bad...but the moment I opened it up for the first time to use at the beach, not only did it spill out with like 6-7 different bags of poles, spikes and more bags (?!?)...the pole set up is clearly for those who regularly set up camping tents (not me unfortunately!!)...and on top of that, if you’re not good at tents, then on a windy day, you will have ZERO chance of setting up as a novice with not being able to hold the shade down to figure things out :( Not a bad product...just not for those who are rookies with camping equipment set up!!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Bond

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Product took about 10 min to assemble. I like that it has a floor to it, and you can close it up for privacy. Tall enough to have standard camp chairs in there and still have head room. Coleman products, in my opinion, are always well made, so I am sure this product will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: this shade was GREAT over the summer at the beach
customer_reviews.text: Edited to add: took the shade out for the first this this season (the second year) and one of the poles snapped. The wind wasn't very strong. I'm disappointed. We probably used it 6 times last year. I'm hoping I can get a replacement pole somewhere. this shade was GREAT over the summer at the beach. it was a lifesaver to keep the baby out of the sun and wind. HOWEVER, it is really difficult to set up and take down and nearly impossible for one person to do alone. When there is wind it gets even more difficult. I love it once set up, but beware it take a little work.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two adults
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today. Bought for a trip we’re taking later this summer. We set it up in our living room to see if we liked it. Definitely takes two people, but took only about seven minutes. Very spacious. My husband is 6’ 2”, and he had plenty of room. Bought two Coleman Beach Chairs to go with the canopy and as you can see from the photo, there is plenty of room for the two chairs for adults. Looking forward to using it at the beach!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Thompson-Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Beach Tent
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent for our trip to the beach and Florida and it was great. Easy to set up. Kind of a pain to take the longer poles out when taking down the tent, but otherwise it was a great tent. The baby played it in. We opened the back for a nice breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Smith-Sattison

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set up in the wind, but totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved our bacon at the beach recently. It was about 95 degrees and my pregnant wife and I were heading to the beach with friends. My wife said that she would be fine without bringing this, but since it's so small when packed up, I brought it anyways! I'm glad I did. We got there and set it up, and my wife was in it all day to get away from the angry yellow ball in the sky. It was very windy, which made setup difficult (the thing is basically a kite), but the included sandbags held it down well. I can't imagine going to the beach again without packing this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality beach tent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome beach shade and fits two adults easily. Great quality compared to others I’ve seen and super easy to put together. Folds away really small and easy to store. We’ve used it at the beach and park on sand and grass and works perfectly! Comes with stakes to push into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Although it’s well made, it’s such a process to ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it’s well made, it’s such a process to put together.I bought this to take my baby to the beach, but it’s nearly impossible to put together on my own- and if it’s windy- this sucker isn’t going to at all. I wish I had returned it and gotten a pop up.
customer_reviews.author: Merilyn M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We took this to the beach this past week, and very much enjoyed being able to extend our stay on the sand without the threat of sunburn. It worked perfectly, we didn't even use the sandbags or stakes, but rather sat our heavy items inside the tent. The screen on the back was perfect to allow a breeze to pass through. It's also a great way to secure your things inside the tent while going into the water, and a way to keep your cell phone and cooler cool. It was easy to set up with two people.
customer_reviews.author: Tim and Donna Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long to install
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product once you go through the hassle of getting it put up. It's not very easy to set up compared to other brands that pop up within seconds. The spikes bend to easily after being pushed down in the beach sand. When I pulled the spikes up at the end of my beach visit they were bent out of shape. The nice thing about this product is the clothes line that's inside to hang up wet clothes. It's not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup if you watch the YouTube videos
customer_reviews.text: Watch the YouTube videos and you'll be able to set this up in no time. For me, it wasn't s hassle to set up or put back in the case. I give this four stars instead of five because the silver spokes bend very easily. Luckily, you can actually get the tent up and keep it up without needing to use all of the silver spokes, even in windy conditions. I've used this at two beaches and a music festival and it has protected me from both the sun and the rain.
customer_reviews.author: TheBooks

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any family who likes spending time outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to using this on our latest fishing trip. You will not be disappointed! It is a little more spendy but this thing is well worth the money. One of the things I like is that you can zip down the windows for more breeze and can also zip up the front for more protection. Ultimately you could use this as a summer time sleep tent in a pinch (for one person). Relatively easy to setup and lightweight/ compact! Best product I've bought for summer time adventures!
customer_reviews.author: Shanny B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for family beach trip
customer_reviews.text: Great sun protection and size for family of 4 (kids 3 and 6). Set-up and take-down were easy enough (we practiced once in the living room before hitting the beach) - though cramming everything back in the bag after a few bevs was a minor challenge. The sandbags were simple and effective anchors. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sara corbello

customer_reviews.title: I love this beach shade
customer_reviews.text: I love this beach shade! It takes about ten minutes for one person to set up, which is fairly easy, although the poles don't stay snapped together well and do get caught in the sleeves during both setup and takedown. It's large enough for two camping chairs or a few people sitting on the ground. It can be completely closed up, and it has ventilation screens just like a tent. It provides a good deal of shade! It doesn't work well on windy days since it catches wind like a sail, but I'm happy with this purchase and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: V.ston

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our younger son to keep cool at his older brother's summer baseball games. It worked perfect! It is easy to put up and take down. Large and roomy inside and provides ample shade. The back opening up also allowed for a great breeze to come through when needed. It has held up to rowdy boys rolling around in it as it quickly became the team hang-out in between games in long tournaments. We were asked by many people where we got our tent! We will use this for many years to come!! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Designed to perform, built to fail.
customer_reviews.text: Coleman designed this for lightweight, quick setup sun protection at the beach, which it is and does. They then used mesh fabric where you push and pull solid ( and relatively sharp poles through to set up and take down. That mesh fabric will not take long before a pole rips right trough it - it's a point of failure that you then will have you deal with every time you use the tent. Take extra care with the poles and the mesh fabric and it should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

product_meta.title: Coleman Beach Shade Shelter
feature_bullets: Portable pop-up beach tent with 50+ UPF sun protection
Extended front floor zips for privacy; back window unzips for ventilation
Integrated storage pockets and a dry line to hang wet clothing
Measures 7 feet 6 inches by 4 feet 5 inches with 4-foot 9-inch center height
Easy setup in about 5 minutes; ground stakes and pre-attached guy lines included

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
